official_title: A bill to improve State criminal justice information systems, including criminal history records; to establish an interstate identification index based on criminal records and to provide assistance to States to use such index; to ensure that criminal history records are accurate and complete; and for other purposes.
short_title: Criminal Justice Information Improvement Act of 1985
subjects: Federal aid to law enforcement agencies

summary.text: Criminal Justice Information Improvement Act of 1985 - Requires the Attorney General to establish and maintain an interstate identification index for the purpose of assisting Federal, State and local agencies to locate criminal identification and crime records held by such agencies. Amends the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968 to authorize grants to State and local governments for developing capabilities necessary to submit and obtain information in the interstate identification index. Establishes within the Department of Justice a National Crime Information Advisory Board. Requires the Board to recommend to the Attorney General general policies regarding the acquisition, classification, storage, and dissemination of such criminal justice information. Requires the Board to review security and privacy aspects with regard to the interstate identification index.
